title: Join us for The Vergecast Live at The Glass Room in San Francisco on October 31st, with guests from Instagram and the Pixel camera team
text:
The Vergecast will return for a live recording in San Francisco, CA on Thursday, October 31st at 7:30 PM. This time we’re thrilled to host the show from The Glass Room: an innovative pop-up exhibition that aims to generate global conversation about technology, data, and privacy.

Vergecast hosts Nilay Patel and Dieter Bohn will by joined by Isaac Reynolds, product manager of the Google Pixel camera; Robby Stein, director of product for Instagram; and Verge senior reporter Ashley Carman for a discussion about how the photos we share influence the photos we take — and vice versa. We can promise Halloween jokes, but not costumes (though your finery is welcome). Stick around after the recording for a reception and birthday toast with Nilay and Dieter — The Verge turns eight years old on November 1st!

Click here to reserve your seats for the show. We’re excited to see you at The Glass Room:

Second floor events space

838 Market Street

San Francisco, CA 94102



Tickets are free, but seating is limited.
